messages: 532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:16): Is it safe to uncleanly shutdown a machine that has no hard drive?
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:16): Or is the clean shutdown for more then just the hard drive?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:21): huh
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:22): yuo mean if running off a lvie cd?
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:22): I've built an embedded system out of an old p2, with the OS on a floppy
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:22): ugh dude
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:22): compact flash to ide adaptor $13
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:22): don't use a floppy :0
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:22): 1.2MB is not worth a CF adaptor
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:23): ok :)
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:23): Does anything other then a HDD need a clean shutdown?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:23): only if the os delays writing
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:23): and buffers in ram
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:23): Read-only floppy :)
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:23): that's the reason hd's need a clean shutdown
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:23): then no you can turn it off any time you like
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:23): The floppy is only even read while the system is booting ;)
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:23): then you can turn it off any time you like
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:23): So a timer plug is ok?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:24): it won't come back up you understand
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:24): unless you enable power back up on power loss in bios
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:24): yeah should be fine
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:24): i got a motherboard covered with cleaner so I gotta run if you are ok
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:24): feel free to idle here
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:25): A mobo covered in cleaner?! o_O
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): yeah orange clean
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:25): How the hell did you do that?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): washing it down
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): machine I fished out of trash
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:25): But you are _WASHING_ the mobo?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): I been doing this a long time :)
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): yeah you can if you know what you are doing
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): cause it's covered with yrso f crap
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:25): Its just some dust :P
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:25): and I plan to plug new cards and stuff and do some solder modding
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:26): I want clean contacts
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:26): I only clean a machine when its too full of dirt for the fans to move properly :)
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:26): yeah like these 2 :)
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:26): anyways we can talk later
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:26): I don't want it drying on there
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:26): You can re-solder the board and remove stuff without killing it?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:26): yes
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:26): Gonna be up for another hour or so before I sleep :)
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (08:27): i'll explain later and feel free to idle here any time
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:27): This channel may as well have a bot named IdleBOT :P
532955c89e894b14fdb8b4ed9383909e (08:29): I read that and I feel hungry now :\
